item.title: Keith add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Keith add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Talent is like electricity. We don't understand electricity. We use it." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Keith add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "The caged bird sings with a fearful trill, of things unknown, but longed for still, and his tune is heard on the distant hill, for the caged bird sings of freedom." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Keith add a quote by Haddon Mark
item.description: "Siobhan says that if you raise one eyebrow it can means lots of different things. It can mean 'I want to do sex with you' and it can also mean 'I think what you just said was very stupid." -- Haddon Mark

item.title: Keith add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I'm going to marry my novels and have little short stories for children." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Keith add a quote by Tony Hoagland
item.description: "There’s Socialism and Communism and Capitalism and there’s Feminism and Hedonism, and there’s Catholicism and Bipedalism and Consumerism, but I think Narcissism is the system that means the most to me." -- Tony Hoagland

item.title: Keith add a quote by Tony Hoagland
item.description:
"Outside the youth center, between the liquor store and the police station, a little dogwood tree is losing its mind;
overflowing with blossomfoam, like a sudsy mug of beer; like a bride ripping off her clothes,
dropping snow white petals to the ground in clouds,
so Nature’s wastefulness seems quietly obscene. It’s been doing that all week: making beauty, and throwing it away, and making more." -- Tony Hoagland

item.title: Keith add a quote by Robert Frank
item.description: "Above all, life for a photographer cannot be a matter of indifference" -- Robert Frank

item.title: Keith add a quote by Wilson Rawls
item.description: "What I saw was more than I could stand. The noise I heard had been made by Little Ann. All her life she had slept by Old Dan's side. And although he was dead, she had left the doghouse, had come back to the porch, and snuggled up by his side." -- Wilson Rawls

item.title: Keith add a quote by Wilson Rawls
item.description:
"After the last shovel of dirt was patted in place, I sat down and let my mind drift back through the years. I thought of the old K. C. Baking Powder can, and the first time I saw my pups in the box at the depot. I thought of the fifty dollars, the nickels and dimes, and the fishermen and blackberry patches.
I looked at his grave and, with tears in my eyes, I voiced these words: "You were worth it, old friend, and a thousand times over." -- Wilson Rawls

item.title: Keith add a quote by Terrance Hayes
item.description: "I am carrying the whimper you can hear when the mouth is collapsed, the wisdom of monkeys. Ask a glass of water why it pities the rain. Ask the lunatic yard dog why it tolerates the leash. Brothers and sisters, when you spend your nights out on a limb, there’s a chance you’ll fall in your sleep." -- Terrance Hayes

item.title: Keith add a quote by Rollo May
item.description: "Poets may be delightful creatures in the meadow or the garret, but they are menaces on the assembly line." -- Rollo May

item.title: Keith add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "Into this wild Abyss/ The womb of Nature, and perhaps her grave--/ Of neither sea, nor shore, nor air, nor fire,/ But all these in their pregnant causes mixed/ Confusedly, and which thus must ever fight,/ Unless the Almighty Maker them ordain/ His dark materials to create more worlds,--/ Into this wild Abyss the wary Fiend/ Stood on the brink of Hell and looked a while,/ Pondering his voyage; for no narrow frith/ He had to cross. " -- John Milton
